alert.note: Alert for Southern Lake County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 31 at 6:16AM PST until January 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Northern Lake and Southern Lake. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...There will be an increased risk of rock and land slides along roadways. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. This may include Scotts Creek impacting Scotts Valley Road and Middle Creek near Upper Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Three to six additional of rain is expected very early Wednesday through Wednesday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
